instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message:
Log attached:- 
[URL]https://cdn.fbsbx.com/v/t59.2708-21/263577824_1110140239722013_5961524403372398280_n.docx/log.docx?_nc_cat=104&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=0cab14&_nc_ohc=rysw3LI0HWUAX_jzS7Y&_nc_ht=cdn.fbsbx.com&oh=318d7005a399f59881b4cd1295e45634&oe=61AB9EE9&dl=1[/URL]
Is it FDMF 6808 issue or something else?   Could someone guide me where I should look first?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message:
You can try clean ME BIOS, just in case.
But you should change FDMF6808N chips anyway.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message: Will it be ok if I take  FDMF6808N from an old board?

threads.message:

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message:
NOOO.
Buy FDMF6708 from reliable store, like Mouser, or Farnell.
You can also use FDMF3030 instead.
FDMF6808 is Apple proprietary chip, never sold for anyone else!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message: SAD, It has 9 months to 1 year lead time in mouser and farnel, I may find some old board to remove this component. How are these buck converters are going bad? Is it only in the 2013 board? Will it be ok if I remove the component from an old 2012 board?

Using FDMF6808N chips recovered from scrap board cannot assure to get the problem fixed.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message:
FDMF6708N are in stock on Mouser here.
Also if you read pinned post you'll see that laptop_mb_seller/L2 Computers are old known scammers, never buy from them. And good luck finding genuine new ICs on Aliexpress these days, there's almost none. No one has new FMDF6808N anyway, they are all pulled from dead boards.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message: Thanks for the message, Are FDMF6708N, FDMF6808N, and  FDMF3030 the same ??

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message: You can use any of FDMF6708/3030 to replace FDMF6808.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message: I have changed all the three FDMF6808 from mouser, Now I get only 1.3V on its output , Laptop is not powering ON , Fans are running

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message:
It powers up, if fans spin; not booting is other thing.
Don't make confusion.

Did you solder FDMF6708?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message:
Yes, I have soldered them, Is there a way I can make sure I have soldered all three of them properly? 
Because I can see 1.33V at the output, One out of three-chip is heating up too much...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message:
Did you apply leaded solder on the board and chips pads?
I hope you've removed CPU heatsink first.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> late 2013 random shutdown with black screen
threads.message:
I have used a hot air gun with a 500 deg temperature to remove the IC, the Same for soldering also... can I try to add more solder lead using a soldering iron.
 Yes, I have removed the CPU heatsink before doing the rework.
